title: Elon Musk Takes a Page Out of Mark Zuckerberg’s Social Media Playbook
description: As Mr. Musk takes over Twitter, he is emulating some of the actions of Mr. Zuckerberg, who leads Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: Tumblr Reverses Nudity Ban
description: Reversing a 2018 ban, the company said that nudity and “mature subject matter” would be allowed. But “visual depictions of sexually explicit acts” remain off limits, the company said.

title: Debunking Voting Misinformation About the Midterm Elections
description: Here are some of the main falsehoods and rumors that have spread on social media in the lead-up to Election Day.

title: Campaigns Pay Influencers to Carry Their Messages, Skirting Political Ad Rules
description: Campaigns are using social media influencers as a way to reach young and diverse voters, a novel and mostly unregulated strategy. Some are even spreading the message through dating apps.

title: Why Does Twitter Verify Some Accounts?
description: Elon Musk, who recently closed a deal to acquire the social media company, could soon charge a monthly fee for the blue verification badge that indicates a Twitter account is authentic.

title: Personal Tech Has Changed. So Must Our Coverage of It.
description: Our tech problems have become more complex, so we are rebooting the Tech Fix column to focus on the societal implications of the tech we use.

title: Debunking Voting Misinformation About the Midterm Elections
description: Here are some of the main falsehoods and rumors that have spread on social media in the lead-up to Election Day.

title: Bill Outlawing Online Suicide Assistance Would Open Sites to Liability
description: Bipartisan legislation in the House targets not only the online activity of individual users but also the website operators hosting it.

title: Security Cameras Make Us Feel Safe, but Are They Worth the Invasion?
description: Internet cameras like Amazon’s Ring come at a high cost to our privacy.

title: Pack Your Bags, We’re Moving to ‘Roku City’
description: Instead of streaming a new TV show or movie, some Roku users are in it for the screen saver.

title: People Love to Hate-Watch Tech Villains. That Won’t Hurt Spotify.
description: “The Playlist” resembles other TV dramas that follow founders to their eventual comeuppance — except Spotify isn’t facing any messy implosion.
